a) have severe thalassemia. Signs and symptoms usually occur within the first 2years of life. They may include severe anemia and other health problems, such as:
                
A pale and listless appearance
                
Poor appetite
                
Dark urine (a sign that red blood cells are breaking down)
                
Slowed growth and delayed puberty
                
Jaundice (a yellowish color of the skin or whites of the eyes)
                
An enlarged spleen, liver, or heart
